attributes.action: Increase the Inheritance Tax Threshold to £2 million in 2007-08
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The Inheritance Tax threshold has not kept pace with house prices over the past decades.  As a result, the numbers liable have soared to more than 35,000 or 6 per cent of estates.  Inheritance Tax was only intended to hit the wealthy, defined as the top 1 per cent of taxpayers.  The threshold should be increased to £2 million to take the burden off ordinary people.  The tax should, however, be retained and not abolished altogether.  The cost of increasing the threshold to £2 million would be about £2.5 billion in 2007-08 and is fully affordable.
